title: Summer Monteys-Fullam dishes on relationships, Bake Off and I'm A Celeb rumours
text:

Paul Hollywood's ex Summer Monteys-Fullam has earned herself a sizeable fan base.

Those very fans sent in questions for the red-headed beauty which she answered on her Instagram story.

The question of ex Paul was bound to come up, with one fan wondering if Summer ever watches The Great British Bake Off , which he judges with Prue Leith.

She had a romance with Paul after his split from estranged wife Alexandra but it turned sour after the silver fox, 53, allegedly demanded Summer sign a document that would stop her from chatting about their relationship.

Filming herself with a filter that made her mouth a cartoon, the 24 year-old gave a definitive: "No!"

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Rumours have been swirling that Summer might be headed Down Under for I'm A Celebrity - the new series will kick off at some point later this year, with presenting duo Ant and Dec back together again.

Putting the rumours to bed, Summer laughed: "No, I'm not going in the jungle. I'm sorry to disappoint you guys!"

The topic came around again later, Summer giggling: "No, I'm sorry! Nope!"

(Image: Instagram)

Summer also revealed what she's learned from past relationships, as one asked her what she reckoned was the best way to get over a rough break-up.

"I would say the best way to get over a break-up would be to start a new adventure," Summer said, "Go on holiday with the girls, or learn a new language so that when you go on holiday you know the new language. Doing what's best for you."

Later, when asked how to deal with a broken heart, she consoled fans: "A broken heart isn't something that's easy to get over, but in your own time, it does get better and in your own time you'll find your Prince Charming or Princess."

"I would say something fun," Summer said of her perfect first date, "I like doing things and going and having fun, so something entertaining as opposed to a dinner date. I do like a dinner date, but something fun preferably."

When it comes to her own relationships, Summer values old fashioned qualities.

Asked what she looks for in a man, she said: "I would say that for a successful relationship to work you'd need a mutual respect for each other, trust for each other and loyalty for each other."

Summer also "100%" wants kids, so long as it's with "one billion per cent the right person."
description: Summer answered questions about her life that fans had sent in and also dealt some relationship wisdom
